Title: gif2png: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in gif2png, the worst of
    which might allow execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: gif2png converts images from GIF format to PNG format.

Description.Text:
Two vulnerabilities have been found in gif2png:

  • A boundary error in gif2png.c could cause a buffer overflow (CVE-2010-4694).
  • The patch for CVE-2009-5018 causes gif2png to truncate GIF pathnames (CVE-2010-4695).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted GIF file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, or the creation of PNG files in unintended directories.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All gif2png users should upgrade to the latest version:
